messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2276
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/22/2002 6:26:40 PM Pacific Daylight Time, ... You can raise worms in a rubbermaid container and keep it under the kitchen sink - easy to
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/22/2002 6:26:40 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> You can make your compost heap in an old shoe box so it can be quickly
> disposed of once you have made your point

You can raise worms in a rubbermaid container and keep it under the kitchen
sink - easy to add scraps, etc. We did that for about a year and then I
finally dumped the whole thing - big fat red worms and all - into our garden
compost.

<A HREF="http://members.tripod.com/~AngieCooks/">Worm Composting! Red Wigglers, Vermicomposting, Recycling, Gardening!</A>

By the way, we bought the worms at a bait shop.

--pamS
National Home Education Network
http://www.NHEN.org
Changing the Way the World Sees Homeschooling!


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
